parse_php_info

function parse_php_info()

This function parses the phpinfo output to get details about a PHP plugin.  http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.phpinfo.php

Returns

html

slash_it

function slash_it($string)

Appends a trailing slash.

Will remove trailing slash if it exists already before adding a trailing slash.  This prevents double slashing a string or path.

The primary use of this is for paths and thus should be used for paths.  It is not restricted to paths and offers no specific path support.

From WordPress

Parameters

$stringstring $string What to add the trailing slash to.

Returns

$stringString with trailing slash added.

See Also

un_slash

un_slash

function un_slash($string)

Removes trailing slash if it exists.

The primary use of this is for paths and thus should be used for paths.  It is not restricted to paths and offers no specific path support.

From WordPress

Parameters

$stringstring $string What to remove the trailing slash from.

Returns

$stringString without the trailing slash.

See Also

slash_it

html_encode

function html_encode($string)

Encodes HTML safely for UTF-8.  Use instead of htmlentities.

Parameters

$stringString containing content

Returns

$stringString cleaned with invalid characters converted to UTF-8

convert_size

function convert_size($num)

Parameters

$numInt

Returns

$numBytes converted to KB, MB, or GB

maybe_encoded

function maybe_encoded($original)

Unserialize value only if it was serialized.  JSON Decode value only if it was JSON encoded

Parameters

$originalstring $original Maybe unserialized or json encoded

Returns

$originalmixed Unserialized/json_decoded data.

maybe_unserialize

Unserialize value only if it was serialized.

From WordPress

Parameters

$originalstring $original Maybe unserialized original, if is needed.

Returns

$originalmixed Unserialized data can be any type.

is_serialized

function is_serialized($data)

Check value to find if it was serialized.

If $data is not an string, then returned value will always be false.  Serialized data is always a string.

From WordPress

Parameters

$datamixed $data Value to check to see if was serialized.  Returns:
boolFalse if not serialized and true if it was.
